Question: How many swaps are required in bubble sort when N elements in the array are already sorted in reverse order?

There are two microprocessors: a 32-bit CPU capable of executing each of 32-bit, 16-bit, and 8-bit long instructions in 1 cycle, and a 16-bit CPU capable of executing each of 16-bit and 8-bit long instructions in 1 cycle. Additionally, the 16-bit CPU can execute a 32-bit instruction by combining 2 cycles. It is assumed that a program's instruction mix is 40% of 16-bit instructions, 40% of 8-bit instructions, and 20% of 32-bit instructions. Which combination of the following costs enables the 16-bit CPU to achieve the same performance as the 32-bit CPU?
